text:
If ssl apache segfaults it leaves shared memory and files that must be removed 
to upon restart:
[Fri Jul 16 07:43:41 2004] [error] (17)File exists: Cannot allocate shared 
memory
The error messages doesn't bother to say "what file"
open("/usr/local/apache2/logs/ssl_scache", O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_EXCL, 0666) = -1 
EEXIST (File exists).
Removing the ssl_scache then gets the same error message but because shared 
memory already exists which must also be manually deleted.

Seems like shared memory startup should be more robust than this...
